author: mtblyf888
comment: Not user friendly. Strava is still better

author: emre enes yavuz
comment: not user-friendly, navigation is really bad

author: Jay Thacker
comment: Overall fantastic but photos taken from inside the app are very potato - nothing near what my phone camera is capable of. That makes me sad. Any chance that can be improved? It really is unfortunate to take a picture back on some beautiful mountain bike trail and then look at it later and the picture quality is pitiful.

reply.author: Ride with GPS
reply.content:
You can get full photo quality by going to Settings > Logging > Photo Upload Size > Full. 

Photos taken outside the app while recording can be selected at the time of  your ride saving so they too will be full rez.

Please contact our support team if you have any further problems at info@ridewithgps.com

author: Charles B
comment: Well it shows me that I'm located in Oregon which is wrong I'm in Arizona and can't find a setting to change it. So how accurate can this app be? I haven't used it yet as I can't even get it to be correct.

author: Vincent Sabio
comment: Great app for tracking individual rides as well as trends and ensemble performance over time. I'd give it five stars if it had Di2 integration/display.

author: Nick Cross
comment: Great app. Allows me to plot routes on computer and follow on the phone. App seems reliable enough after over a year of usage (have paid for navigation etc). Helpful support team.

author: Rob Tulloh
comment: I use the web site all the time . The app just crashes every time I try to use it
I use this for all my cycling needs - from navigating while riding, planning routes for my cycling group and finding rides I want to go on.

author: Mike McNamara
comment: Great app, use it every bike ride.

author: Kenn Kiser
comment: I used MapMyRide for nearly a year, then a friend introduced me to this app. It provides nearly twice the stats at the free level, & for $5.99/month you can unlock many more. Our recumbent trike group use this app to share stats, ride photos, track rides, & plan routes. I highly recommend Ride with GPS to cyclists.

author: Jorge L Martínez
comment: So here is one for developers , first off what kind of professional app does not have an undo functionality when you accidentally delete a ride? This app should have it. Second : today I went for a ride after my ride I saved it & named it , saved it, I then thought of a better name for it so went back to rename it only to realize that even if you rename it it does not change the name of the ride when you actually share it on another app say what's up or SMS. I then thought well I will delete my online version that uploaded from my phone and then upload my phone version with the correct name. After I did this I lost my ride, the app also deleted my phone version! . This is poor programming design and for a professional app it's unacceptable. Thankfully I also had my Strava file and was able to import it

author: Gary Cohen
comment: I tried Strava. Velo Pal and others.   I think this one is the best.  Others sometimes lost connection and failed to record. Sometimes they added every step I took in a restaurant even when the app was paused.  And I appreciate that this app doesn't prod me to compete with every other cyclist in the neighborhood.  Highly recommended.

author: Susan Willows
comment: I've had an awful time with thus app. There is a screen somewhere that allows you to upload workouts manually. - when you forgot to record it. I can't find that screen to enter a workout. It's very frustrating. I love Map My Ride.

reply.author: Ride with GPS
reply.content:
Susan,

You can upload a ride manually on the website but not within the app. Learn how with our extensive help articles: https://ridewithgps.com/help/log-manually

You can also contact our support team at any time with questions on using the app and website. Cheers!

comment: I have no idea whether this app is any good or not, seeing as all it ever does is display a message across my screen saying "Acquiring GPS Signal". Every other GPS enabled app on my phone works perfectly, so why RWGPS seems completely unable to find me is a real mystery. I've tried the app in my garden, in the street outside my house and even in my local town centre, but it still can't seem to find me.   UPDATE  After emailing the excellent customer support at RWGPS they have explained to me how to fix this issue. I have therefore changed my rating to 5 stars.

reply.author: Ride with GPS
reply.content: We can help! Please contact our eager support team at info@ridewithgps.com to get this resolved ASAP. The fix is won't fit in a review response.

author: Brian Cooke
comment: Good app, 2 things I'd love to see are the trail names more easy to read on your device (as easy as Trailforks is to read). Secondly the ability to create routes on your device & not just on a computer. This last feature would be HUGE!  Thanks

author: evelyn woolston
comment: Thanks Jordan for telling me  how to get rid of the stats area by toggling the oval menu button. An excellent free cycling app but too dear to upgrade . It works really well keeping track of where you bike, reports distance, gradient etc. The GSM cycle map layer gives loads of off road tracks and I would not have begrudged paying a one-off payment for a pro version but they want £6 a month which is too much for me.

author: michael povman
comment: I love this app.  Have used it for years.  Deducting a star because the latest version keeps crashing on me when I try to view my routes.  Hopefully this will be fixed soon.

reply.author: Ride with GPS
reply.content: We would love to get this resolved. Please email our support team at info@ridewithgps.com with details or reproduction steps as to when this crash happens. Is it any route or always a specific route that causes the crash?

author: Waleed Omran
comment: Very nice app with customizable activity recording screen. Can't understand why ppl prefer Strava over this. I tried both and this app is winning by huge margin!

author: vicky 5636
comment: This is just an awesome app.. it pauses when you stop moving. It records all the data such as elevation, speed, distance.

author: Ryder Byke
comment: Everything I need from a GPS data logging service, especially as I am not trying to beat yesterday or win every ride.  Huge number of mapping features, all the metrics I need and great support from the developer.  Adding photos and reports the icing on the cake 👍🚴

reply.author: Ride with GPS
reply.content:
Thanks for the review! 

The 'Feed' crash is fixed in the next release of the app. Coming very soon!

If you would like to make a one time contribution, please email us at info@ridewithgps.com

Cheers!

author: Kwesi Parkes
comment: I really enjoy that the app voice cues  advise when a turn is coming up. However, I think it would be beneficial if the name of the road were read aloud when the advance warnings are given, not only when you were already at the intersection.

author: Ron Lyell
comment: tried to make a route from a recorded ride with cue sheets as advertised. cannot find half the pages you need for this. very poorly designed app.

reply.author: Ride with GPS
reply.content: You'll have to do all your route planning on the website. You can learn how to use all the tools on the website in our help portal: https://ridewithgps.com/help/. If you need some direction or have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact our support team at any time at info@ridewithgps.com. We'll always be happy to get you rolling again.

comment: Elevation data much more accurate when you use the replace feature, which seems to overwrite the logged data. If for a small fee a version could show average speed per each mile it would be perfect.

author: Raghu Nandan Nagaraja
comment: Navigation, offline route map... only with subscription. Free version is just another average/below average app. Do not even try if looking for free application...

reply.author: Ride with GPS
reply.content: Raghu, Premium is not required for all the extra features on the mobile app, you can get them all with a Basic subscription at a much lower cost. However, a Premium account does open more features on the website to help you plan routes and manage your ride data. Please contact our support team if you ever have any questions at info@ridewithgps.com

author: Ron White
comment: I love RWGPS as it provides tools to find,  record,  edit,  and share rides. Through search I can find suitable rides to download and use almost everywhere I go. I can create or edit existing rides through relatively easy to use ride tracing techniques. Many group rides now provide RWGPS files to support rides. It's a great tool.

author: Bruce Johnson
comment: I am giving up. I tried downloading the route for my club's century, and even though the app said the route was on my phone, it seemed to want to download again when I tried to ride. And the day before, on another ride, my phone got hot and the battery lost over 50% in an hour. Uninstalling it.

reply.author: Ride with GPS
reply.content: Hi Bruce, sorry to hear the app didn't work out for you. We've love a chance to help get this resolved. Please contact our support team at any time at info@ridewithgps.com

author: Graham Schulz
comment: Looking for an app that lets you create routes? This one isn't it. You have to use the website, so the app is useless for my purposes.

author: Robert Zimiga
comment: Offline not reliable...cuts out and had to catch up...Offline wouldn't load map right before my ride..

reply.author: Ride with GPS
reply.content: We would love a chance to help figure out why it's cutting out on you. Please contact our support team at info@ridewithgps.com to get you rolling ASAP.

comment: Very accurate and user friendly. What more could you want? Extremely accurate GPS readings!
terrible off line mode, freezes constantly... so navigate feature is almost unusable, went to another app

reply.author: Ride with GPS
reply.content: Sorry to hear about the app freezing. Please contact our support team at info@ridewithgps.com so we can get more information and fix the problem.

author: Hadi Yousef
comment: The best app on the market for its purpose! Way better than strava imo

author: Daniel Grisham
comment: Was so excited to try this out until I found out it's $7/month. 🖕🏼

author: Andy Ibbotson
comment: Great app, switched over from Strava as it is so slooow.

author: Jeff Nordberg
comment: Inconsistent logging. Very disappointing.

reply.author: Ride with GPS
reply.content: We just released an update to the app that fixes the logging issue. Our support team would love to help you out should you have any further issues. info@ridewithgps.com

author: Dave Cain
comment: Works well, dependable seems accurate

author: Chaim Birnboim
comment: Very good.  I use it for tracking bike rides with friends. Different views of the maps are great.

author: Mihai Svetenco
comment: Nice customer suport, good features

author: Steve Kefford
comment: Great for planing rides.

author: Eric Taba
comment: Sucks

author: Jorge Diaz
comment: Love this app!
